Legal_Issue: Application of s. 108(4) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act regarding 'compelling reasons'
Evidence_Type: Mistreatment of family member, police invasions
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Past persecution and its relevance to current refugee status
Application_Error: Misapplication of 'compelling reasons' standard; imposing rigid test
Assessment_Standard: Existence of compelling reasons arising from past persecution
Evidence_Ignored: Significance of mistreatment of applicantâ€™s father and police invasions as potential compelling reasons
Legal_Standard: Interpretation of 'compelling reasons' under s. 108(4) IRPA
Application_Factor: Impact of past persecution on refugee eligibility despite changed country conditions
Decision_Outcome: Remitted for redetermination by a newly constituted Board
Decision_Review_Issue: Correctness of legal interpretation by the Board
Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient severity of past events according to erroneous standard
Evidentiary_Issues: Downplaying significance of familial persecution without proper legal framework
Procedural_Fairness: Failure to apply correct legal test affecting fairness of determination
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claimant challenged misapplication of law in judicial review
Omission_Type: Failure to consider applicable legal standard for compelling reasons
